programme.title: Grimm
programme.desc: Monroe investigates a robbery at a wesen church and some suspicious activity among the flock.

programme.title: Warehouse 13
programme.desc: While Pete and Myka are trapped in the warehouse, Artie must answer to his superiors.

programme.title: Brit Cops: Rapid Response
programme.desc: Following rapid response officers, the fastest cops in Britain, as they crack down on crime.

programme.title: The Force: North East
programme.desc: Following the day to day challanges and investigations of polices forces from North East England.

programme.title: Wild Survivors
programme.desc: The drive to reproduce is the one of the most primal forces in nature. It dictates how any given species will behave for most of its life. There are over a hundred thousand species of animal in Africa, so there are countless strategies to find a mate.

programme.title: Wild Survivors
programme.desc: Finding food is the most immediate need for any animal. Food is the fuel that gives an animal strength to fight, or to flee. But in the Luangwa valley the dry season is at its height and the landscape has become cruel and barren.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.sub-title: Hyenas and Lions: Life in the Leftovers
programme.desc: The two top carnivore species.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Every day a struggle for survival plays out across Africa. Predators binge on the dead and natures undertakers circle above waiting for their chance.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Their ancestors were the first vertebrates to colonise dry land and frogs inhabit every continent except Antarctica, but their world is rapidly changing. What was once wetlands are now playgrounds, golf courses and race tracks.

programme.title: Wildlife Icons
programme.desc: Once abundant on the continent, elephant populations have been drastically reduced by hunting for ivory and meat in the last 200 years. Yet there are pockets of hope for these giants, found in elephant conservation reserves like Addo Elephant Park.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.desc: Discover how different animals use the terrain to their advantage and their unique attributes to defeat their opponents at each location, becoming masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.desc: In oceans, lakes, and rivers, there are underwater war zones. There are also some creatures that have brutal skirmishes above the waves that determine who wins and who dies.

programme.title: Shark: British Isles Special with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve explores a world of sharks right on your doorstep. Meet everything from Basking sharks to Angelsharks which have never been filmed before, and discover the threats these sharks face.

programme.title: Monkeys and More: Our Closest Relatives
programme.desc: Ever wonder how closely related humans, monkeys, and apes really are? Visit primate habitats to get an intimate look into their complex societies and observe these intelligent animals loving, working, loafing, fighting, and sharing just like we do.

programme.title: Pride Rules
programme.desc: Feel the heat when the pride tries to hunt down adequate food as drought conditions push them (and their prey) dangerously close to death.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Natural History Museum Alive
programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough brings the wonders of the Natural History Museums astonishing collection to life. During a magical, after-hours journey, he brings you closer than ever before to the extraordinary creatures that once roamed our planet.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Right beneath our feet is a secret world of disguise and espionage, social networking and courtship, rape and pillage, parenthood and relationships. Sir David Attenborough investigates how macroscopic residents outwit their enemies to survive.

programme.title: Micro Monsters With David Attenborough
programme.desc: Its a bug-eating world out there, and the documentary continues with a look at how the various critters disable the defences of their respective prey.

programme.title: Alaskan Summer
programme.desc: The effects of summer weather on Alaskan wildlife.

programme.title: Americas Wild Seasons
programme.desc: In autumn, change sweeps across America. As the trees greet the chill with a blaze of color, its make or break time for animals. Time to pull up stakes, make last minute preparations, and often find a mate before the cold sets in.

programme.title: Americas Wild Seasons
programme.desc: Winter is the ultimate challenge. As temperatures plunge across much of America, some animals escape to milder climes of the South, while others stay put and tough out the brutal cold and blizzards that blanket the North.

programme.title: Pride Rules
programme.desc: Feel the heat when the pride tries to hunt down adequate food as drought conditions push them (and their prey) dangerously close to death.

programme.title: Monkeys and More: Our Closest Relatives
programme.desc: Ever wonder how closely related humans, monkeys, and apes really are? Visit primate habitats to get an intimate look into their complex societies and observe these intelligent animals loving, working, loafing, fighting, and sharing just like we do.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Return to South Luangwa to see the new pups born to the mighty Manzi and the tiny-but-fearless Kakumbi packs. See yearling Snowy face a hungry hyena before a lion pride scatters Manzi mum Wekas pups and leaves her frantically searching for them.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Run into a lion-hyena showdown with Julz as he hunts for the elusive Manzi pack, who are missing four of their precious pups. Then join Henry from the Zambian Carnivore Programme on a house call to the Kakumbi den, where another pup has gone AWOL.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Julz and park scout Simon track the Kakuli pack who they filmed previously, and a Manzi faction whove ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group. The Kakumbi making a kill before a happy Manzi reunion.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Encountering an elephant as Julz and Henry track the Kakumbi pups who face off with a stubborn, razor-tusked warthog. ZCPs lion specialist Thandie Mweetwa counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: The Kakumbi see a leopard whos been stalking them, Julz goes fishing with Simon, explores mealtime pack hierarchy and witnesses a heartbreaking vigil for a badly injured Kakumbi pup.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs. Pride
programme.desc: Heading back to the den with the Kakumbi who are mourning the loss of two pups. A look at a hyena den and lion pride trying to take down a buffalo and catching up with the Manzi who are in a standoff with a leopard and a herd of angry elephants.

programme.title: Arctic Secrets
programme.desc: This episode visually illustrates how the Arctic, locked in darkness for nearly seven months, springs to life once the sun rises above the horizon. We explore ideas of migration, hibernation, the food web and habitat change.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: A look at the lives of monkeys, chimps, orangutans, and apes living at the worlds biggest sanctuary, the 65-acre Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre in Wareham, Dorset.

programme.desc: Check out vet Phils clever tactics for handling prickly patients and marvel as RSPCA rescuer Chantel extracts a sooty possum duo from a chimney. Cheer on the clinics favourite survivor and see vet Meaghan unhook a curlew whos the catch of the day.

programme.title: Killer Couples
programme.desc: "Killer Couples" is in the same vein of the long-running true-crime series "Snapped," which tells stories of people who commit murder or attempt murder, but with a focus on couples who commit crimes. Using re-creations and firsthand accounts, each episode digs into a case, telling the story of the couples romance, how the relationship evolved from love to manipulation, and what ultimately led the couple to commit the crime. The stories range from teenage lovers who go on a multistate crime spree to lesbian lovers who want to eliminate one of their husbands.

programme.desc: Big business and high rolling lifestyles turn deadly in a twisted, globe-trotting tale of deception, lies and murder.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his Appletons guide, Michael Portillo continues his rail journey through Connecticut and New England. He takes a crash course in rowing in New Haven, where college teams from Yale and Harvard have battled for victory on the water since 1852. In Vermont, Michael visits a 19th-century farm, where the rich milk from prized Jersey cows imported from the British Isles supplied a thriving butter industry.

programme.title: Great American Railroad Journeys
programme.desc: In the vibrant metropolis of Montreal, Michael discovers how French and British colonial roots have influenced the citys construction, cuisine and culture. Undaunted by his guidebooks description of the treacherous Lachine Rapids, he gets a thorough soaking on a white-knuckle boat ride down the St Lawrence River.

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos `Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel leads him on a railway journey through the modern south Indian states of Karnataka and Tamil Nadu, from the former princely state of Mysore to the first stronghold of the East India Company in Chennai,formerly Madras.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Ocean Venture is in the grip of a storm, her nets caught on the seabed, and skipper John Buchan must rely on his first mate Barry Lauder to free them. Meanwhile, skipper Jimmy Buchan takes his trawler Amity to fish in a deep and jagged underwater ravine. His first mate Kevin ODonnell worries that Jimmys determination to land a catch of good quality prawns will damage the nets and keep her crew at sea for longer than is safe.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Faced with ominous weather warnings, Sandy Watt must decide whether to brave violent storms or head for the safety of the harbour. Two much larger boats, the trawlers Starlight and Starlight Rays, hunt as a pair. Their skippers and crews must have complete trust in each others skill and judgement - when casting their nets on perilous seas the trawlers come within a stones throw of each other.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Skipper James Buchan practises a form of fishing that dates back almost two hundred years.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: There is a triple collection of desirable cars in store for Derek when an MG Midget, an Austin-Healey frogeye Sprite and an RS2000 come up for auction.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Daves son Jack is heading out to Cheshire to collect two cars with a 35-year age difference. And luckily for Mathewsons, Lucy knows exactly what has been brought in for auction.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Bangers and Cash spin-off series that follows the journey of a vehicle purchased at a Mathewsons classic car auction, before being repaired, restored and re-auctioned.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Will and Gus look to make some quick cash as they fix and wrap a Toyota MR2 MK2. But is there money to be made in this low-spec car?

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: A stunning look at how mammals dominate the planet through intelligence, having warm blood, and the care they lavish on their young. A mother Weddell seal wears her teeth down keeping open a hole in the ice so she can catch fish for her pup, cameras follow the migration of millions of bats in Zambia and thousands of caribou across the Arctic tundra, while male humpback whales are shown battling for a female.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: A look at how fish dominate the planets waters through their variety of shape and behaviour. The male weedy sea dragon protects its eggs by carrying them on his tail, while the sarcastic fringehead appears to turn its head inside out when it fights. Later, slow motion cameras show flying fish gliding through the air like a flock of birds, and capture the worlds fastest swimmer, the sailfish, plucking sardines from a shoal.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An incredible look at birds reveals some of the extraordinary things that having feathers allows them to do. For the first time, a slow-motion camera captures the unique flight of the marvellous spatuletail hummingbird, and aerial photography takes us into the sky with an Ethiopian lammergeier. Also featured are the spectacular massed gathering of pink flamingoes, and the comic mating display of the sage grouse.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An incredible look at insects and how their armoured covering allowed them to become the most successful animal group ever. The camera flies with millions of monarch butterflies, while super slow motion shows a bombardier beetle firing boiling liquid at enemies through a rotating nozzle. Later, a honey bee army is seen stinging a raiding bear into submission, and a complex colony of grass cutter ants is seen like never before.

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon visits Istanbul, the beaches and crystal clear waters of the Aegean Sea, before ending up at the war torn border with Syria. He meets a producer now trying to sell wine in a Muslim country with an increasingly conservative government.
